strings.Value: [Examine the rules] "Something is obviously wrong here..."
"The last rule has been added to the others. I would say someone inserted it on purpose and charmed the scroll somehow."
"I don't know what to believe. Maybe it's supposed to be like this?"
"We don't have time to deal with this. The debates are beginning."
"Don't worry, I'll question everyone here and identify the 'trickster'."
"Hell no. These are the circumstances. We'll just have to go as is."
"I've a better idea. Let Linzi buy us some time. I'll talk to the other participants."

"Item four, the most important one: the participant must assume the shape of a giant frog!" {n}Jubilost looks puzzled.{/n} "A frog? What does that have to do with anything? Are those the right rules for the competition? What irresponsible word-monger ma..."

"Item four, the most important one: the participant must say TENTACLES at least every ten words." What's this nonsense? I expected to see tentacles... I mean, a description of the rules of the tentacles! Wait... what the... am I really talking about tentacles all the time now?!"

"Item four, the most important one: the participant must routinely enter desperate screaming fits." Wait, what is this? And where are the rules?! Where are the conditions! And the principles?! I'M ASKING YOU!!"

{n}Fixing his glasses, Jubilost looks at the paper describing the rules.{/n} "Well, let's see. I'll read out loud so that everyone can hear. 'Rules of the Inconsequent Debates, year to be added later...' I see the authors didn't overstrain themselves! So, the rules: 'Item one – obey the Host in everything. Item two – come in triplets. Item three – no fighting, no killing each other (even temporarily) (even if you really want to) (even if you apologize later!)."
"What is this?! Am I – I! – a frog?!"

{n}Jubilost turns his head from side to side, throws his hands in the air as if trying to close his mouth.{/n} "{name}! I'm not joking. This is some kind of tentacles! It is making me say 'tentacles' every few words!"

{n}Jubilost stops, puzzled, then opens and closes his mouth, and then carefully says,{/n} "Well. I think my nerves are failing me. I need to CONTROL MYSELF, MAY THE {g|Bleaching}BLEACHING{/g} EAT ME!! No, it's not nerves. It appears to be some kind of MAGIC, DAMN IT! I CAN'T STOP SCREAMING!"
{n}It's not difficult to see that the text of the last item of the rules is a little different from the others. It looks like someone just added it in, vaguely copying the style.{/n}
{n}Examination offers nothing. Just like anything else that involves the fey, the rules scroll looks ordinary and suspicious at the same time.{/n}

"That's sabotage!" {n}The huge frog can't keep his peace, and croaks in indignation.{/n} "Turning me – me! – into a giant ugly toad! How, would you please tell me, am I supposed to participate in the debates like this? I didn't carefully rehearse my image and the impressions I make on my listeners just to lose it all in a snap! And what if this spell can't be lifted? My admirers won't even recognize me!"

"It looks like someone's idea of a tentacles. I'll find that joker and make him eat my tentacles! Ugh! With indignation and bombs! Then he'll know what tentacles means!" {n} Jubilost grabs his head.{/n} "What am I to do? If this doesn't stop, tentacles won't be able to participate in the tenta...aaa...cles."

"THAT'S JUST GREAT! It looks like someone decided to play a joke on the participants! And how do I come across now, tell me? Farewell to my graceful and sophisticated manner of speech, honed over the years. Now I just start SCREAMING LIKE AN ILLITERATE BUMPKIN!"
"Don't be upset! You're not an ugly frog. In fact you're rather a handsome one!"

"No, I can't bear this! Are you saying that the last rule was written in? Some other participant must have done it to hinder their rivals. {Name}, we need to find the 'trickster' and make them fix it!"
"Don't worry about anything. I'll go run to the Host and ask him a few questions for my book! It'll buy you some time. You start looking for whoever is responsible for this."

"This. Is. Not. Funny. Are you saying the last tentacles was – ahem, the last rule was written in? Some other tentacles must have done it. Participant! We need to find whoever tentacles this immediately. Let them get these tentacles from me!"

"We used to play a game at the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy{/g}, where we had to make a song, and repeat a word every few lines! Let me try... How might I look impeccable when I keep saying 'tentacles'? To do so I would recommend holding out a tentacle to your friend!"
"I'd like to learn a spell like that. Sometimes you need to make a bold statement!"
"What a pathetic, petty, mean-spirited attempt to prevent me from participating in the debates. We need to find out who is behind this. WE NEED TO DO IT NOW!"
"Hey, friends! The Host thinks we're ready to start! Get ready to tremble! You're going to be competing against the great and mighty – me!"
"So, we're just going to leave it as it is?!"
"You want me to read this nonsense again? Fine, fine... it's not going to get any worse..."
"You want me to READ THIS NONSENSE?! FINE! It's not going to get any worse..."
"You want me to read this tentacles again? Fine, fine... It can't get any worse than tentacles..."

"It starts the same, and then... 'Item four, the most important one: the participant must say TENTACLES at least every ten words.' Wait, did it work? I'm not a frog any more? Thank tentacles! Wait. What was that? I meant to say, thank {g|Desna}Desna{/g}! I'm probably just tentacles. I meant, tired! Just tired! It makes me tentacles! Aaargh!"

"It starts the same, and then... 'Item four, the most important one: the participant must routinely enter desperate screaming fits.' Oh, it worked! I'm NOT A DISGUSTING AMPHIBIAN ANY MORE! But why am I SCREAMING AND I CAN'T STOP?!"

"It starts the same, and then... 'Item four, the most important one: the participant must assume the shape of a giant frog!' ... {name}, tell me what happened? I feel strange! A bit larger than usual. A bit four-legged and naked. A bit yearning to gobble up that fly..."

"It starts the same, and then... 'Item four, the most important one: the participant must routinely enter desperate screaming fits.' Ha-ha. If this rule scroll is really charmed, IT WILL BE SO MUCH FUN! Wait... did I really just scream that? I? I'm the model of ACADEMIC TACT AND RESTRAINT?! What is going on, FOR THE LOVE OF {g|Desna}DESNA{/g}?!"

"It starts the same, and then... 'Item four, the most important one: the participant must assume the shape of a giant frog!' No. No, no and no. It's just an illusion, right? I am still a charming, intellectual-looking gnome, and not a huge slimy disgusting amphibian!"

"It starts the same, and then... 'Item four, the most important one: the participant must say TENTACLES at least every ten words.' Oh my, someone has such a delicate and brilliant sense of tentacles. Humor. Who would have thought! Someone so sophisticated, eloquent, and tentacles, such as I... Ahem, actually I meant to say, 'someone as tentacles as I'. Sophisticated! As I... would fill his speech with tentacles... Nooo! I refuse to believe this is really happening!"
